title: Canada holds 1-0 lead through two periods: Live updates from USA-Canada women's hockey gold medal game
content: The two juggernauts battle it out for the ultimate glory. Follow along live for goals and top moments.

title: Stolz's bid for four golds ends with 1500m silver
content: American speedskater Jordan Stolz's bid for a third gold medal and hopes for four overall at the Milan Cortina Olympics came up short with a loss to China's Ning Zhongyan in the 1,500 meters.

title: Eagles All-Pro RT Johnson to return for '26 season
content: Eagles right tackle Lane Johnson confirmed to ESPN on Thursday that he will be returning for a 14th season.

title: Indiana passes bill to lure Bears from Chicago
content: The Bears' search for a new home took a "meaningful step" forward Thursday, opening the door for the storied franchise to leave Illinois to potentially build a new, domed stadium in Indiana.

title: Suns owner bashes tanking as 'done by losers'
content: Suns owner Mat Ishbia sounded off on the issue of tanking in the NBA, calling it a "losing behavior done by losers" and "much worse than any prop bet scandal."

title: Hornets' Ball OK to play day after car accident
content: Hornets point guard LaMelo Ball is not listed on the team's injury report and is expected to play Thursday night against the Rockets, one day after being involved in a two-car crash.

title: Peterson's cramping exit draws Self's concern
content: Kansas freshman Darryn Peterson was limited to just the first three minutes of the second half against Oklahoma State with a cramping issue that coach Bill Self called concerning.

title: Crosby 'by no means' out of Games, Cooper says
content: Canada is taking Sidney Crosby's injury "day by day," coach Jon Cooper said, as the team prepares for its Olympic semifinal against Finland.

title: Flagg's Mavericks debut jersey sells for $1 million
content: The jersey worn by Cooper Flagg in the first half of his NBA debut has been sold for $1 million, a record for a collectible of the Mavericks rookie.

title: ⛸️ Olympic skating costumes: Designs! Drama!
content: A bull, a building or a matador -- will Team USA's figure skating style win gold at the 2026 Winter Games? Learn more about fashion on the ice now.

title: The NBA's 10 biggest offseason questions: Why this summer could get wild
content: How will teams such as the Lakers, Bucks, Warriors and Knicks attack the offseason? Here's everything Bobby Marks is watching.

title: What could the Eagles get back in an A.J. Brown trade? We crafted four offers
content: Brown could get traded this offseason. Could Buffalo be a good fit? Baltimore? Let's project his market with four offers and a verdict.

title: 32 candidates to get cut, traded and passed over this offseason: Names to watch
content: Let's pick out players who could use a change of scenery for the 2026 season, including David Montgomery.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: U.S. women's hockey, Alysa Liu looking for gold and more
content: Thursday is headlined by the U.S. facing Canada and figure skater Alysa Liu looking to snap a 20-year drought.

title: Men's Freshman of the Year contenders: a new-look top 3, Mikel Brown Jr. returns
content: Darius Acuff Jr. makes a big leap, Mikel Brown Jr. reenters -- and Darryn Peterson plummets down the rankings.

title: Who are MLB's best first basemen? Buster Olney ranks the top 10
content: Our top-10 rankings continue with a look at baseball's best first basemen, including the A's budding star.

title: UCL talking points: PSG's comeback win, Bodø/Glimt surprise Inter, more
content: The first legs of the UEFA Champions League knockout playoffs are in the books, and we have a lot to review.

title: No respite for World Cup fans affected by Trump travel restrictions
content: Members of the Haitian and Senegalese communities in the U.S. react to President Donald Trump's visa restrictions ahead of the World Cup.

title: Power Rankings: How the Terps returned to the top 16
content: After riding a four-game losing streak into February, the Terps have turned it around, winning four in a row.

title: Bracketology: Will Stanford miss the NCAA tournament again?
content: Teams with a high NET ranking are typically tournament locks. So why are the Huskers in the Last Four In?

title: Humility, charitable foundation keep Larry Fitzgerald grounded after HOF nod
content: "It's an amazing, amazing thing to be a Hall of Famer, but the light bill still came," Larry Fitzgerald said, keeping life in perspective.

title: 'Shoresy' hits the road with NHL superstars
content: The creator of the Hulu hit kept a diary of the live tour. He shares it ahead of the Season 5 U.S. debut.

title: No Crosby, no problem? What we learned in Canada's thrilling 4-3 win over Czechia
content: The overwhelming tournament favorites needed a late tying goal and overtime to win, but they made the semis.

title: 25 years after his death, Earnhardt's presence lives on in Daytona
content: It's been 25 years since Dale Earnhardt tragically died in Daytona, but a quarter century after his passing, his legacy lives large throughout NASCAR.

title: No union president -- in a CBA year? What's next for MLBPA after Clark shocker
content: With labor negotiations ahead, losing the union president is a shock. But the MLBPA has an opportunity to come out of this stronger.

title: Is it happening again? Arsenal's stumble in title race follows familiar pattern
content: Arsenal's Premier League championship charge suffered yet another wobble on Wednesday, leaving many Gunners fans to wonder: "Is it happening again?"

title: Don't be surprised if ...  Tyrese Maxey is top points scorer
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Tyrese Maxey, Jayson Tatum and more.

title: Who can you count on to play the most down the stretch?
content: The best ability is availability, and while some stars are shut down, here are those who will be out there.

title: Nine tips to help you win your league
content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Mario Barrios-Ryan Garcia: Picks, predictions, more
content: Two fighters and two trainers share their analysis and predictions for the Mario Barrios-Ryan Garcia title fight.

title: Betting buzz: Seahawks tied with 10 others for highest win total
content: The champion Seahawks are among 11 teams whose win total opened at 10.5, the highest number on the board.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool look to Spurs' Bergvall
content: Liverpool are considering making a move for Tottenham Hotspur midfielder Lucas Bergvall. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Travel operators seek road tax relief, rollback of 3% cess in pre-Budget memorandum
content: To help achieve the targets under the Tourism Policy 2024–29, the association sought tax exemptions or reductions for tourist vehicles, including mini buses, multi-utility vehicles

title: India attends Trump's Board of Peace meeting as observer nation
content: India has not joined the Board of Peace, which has been set up by Mr. Trump for the redevelopment of the Gaza Strip

title: Heritage Dairy never compromised on quality, says Bhuvaneswari
content: Each one of the products reaches the customers only after passing 25 quality tests, says its Vice-Chairperson and Managing Director

title: Ponniyathangam festival draws crowds, praise from Chief Minister
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan spends over half an hour watching high-energy Kalaripayattu performances at the Ponniyathangam festival, praising its growing public appeal. The event features martial arts displays, cultural competitions and musical performances, drawing enthusiastic crowds and participants from across the country.

title: Indian Americans largely disapprove of Trump’s first year job performance, but Democrats do not benefit: Survey
content: Broken down by policy areas, the disapproval rates are 64% for immigration policies, 68% for domestic economic policy and 70% for international economic policy (trade, tariffs, sanctions)

title: Kerala Minister Sivankutty launches State-level construction of model autism centres
content: Minister says autism complexes intended to prioritise individual learning and therapy of differently abled

title: Green protocol to be tightened for Attukal Pongala fete
content: District Collector Anu Kumari releases brochure of ‘Bhakthikku Vritthi Mukhyam’ mega campaign prepared by disrict Suchitwa Mission

title: Anil Ambani assures Supreme Court he has no plans or intention to leave the country
content: Anil Ambani files affidavit saying he will appear before ED on February 26 and fully cooperate with the probe into an alleged bank fraud case, will not leave India without prior permission from the court

title: Shillong MP Ricky Andrew J. Syngkon passes away
content: The 54-year-old Ricky Andrew J. Syngkon, who represented the Voice of the People Party, suffered a cardiac arrest; he reportedly collapsed while playing football in Mawiong on the outskirts of Meghalaya’s capital

title: Lokesh tells officials to focus on job creation for youths in A.P.
content: Officials instructed to include the notification for faculty posts in State universities and government degree colleges in Ugadi Job Calendar

title: Uttar Pradesh Congress leaders push for mass FIRs against Assam CM for ‘communal’ statements
content: Congress leader Shahnawaz Alam has urged the judiciary to take suo motu cognisance of the statements and initiate action against Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: Calling Ramakrishna Swami reflects insensitivity, Mamata reacts to PM’s social media post
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi “not to discover new prefixes and suffixes for the great Renaissance figures of Bengal who shaped modern India”

title: Bangladeshi fugitive wanted for murder of police officer deported
content: Government officials identified the man as Ahmed Raza Hasan Mehdi, who was intercepted by immigration authorities while he was attempting to board a flight to a European destination

title: Attacking doctors, raising wild allegation of medical negligence unacceptable: KGMOA
content: KGMOA observes protest day at Nedumangad hospital by suspending all services except emergency care. They will launch indefinite non-cooperation strike on Friday, abstaining from all duties other than patient care

title: Trying to bridge gap between warring communities: Manipur CM
content: CM attends programme to distribute benefits worth ₹33 crore to IDPs; promises full security for Kuki-Zo people seeking medical treatment in Imphal, help for Kuki-Zo students whose studies were hit by conflict

title: Improper landing technique by trainee pilot led to serious incident at Kalaburagi Airport: DGCA probe
content: According to the report, the probable cause of the incident is that the trainee pilot’s failure to execute a proper recovery from the bounced landing contributed to the incident

title: Karnataka makes NABH or NQAS accreditation mandatory for all blood centres
content: The directive has been issued through a Government Order dated February 17, 2026, following a proposal from the Karnataka State AIDS Prevention Society and consultations with NABH authorities

title: Patient care services at medical college hospitals in Kerala hit by doctors’ strike
content: Medical college doctors, who have been on an indefinite boycott of outpatient clinics and teaching activities, have suspended all non-emergency surgeries and procedures since Thursday

title: PMLA court orders restitution of ₹65 crore assets in Popular Group case
content: The properties, movable assets worth ₹33.20 crore and immovable assets worth ₹31.87 crore, were attached by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with a case registered on September 17, 2020

title: Governor tells V-Cs to abide by Kerala HC directive on campus politics
content: The court has ordered formulation of a mechanism to regulate political activities of students and to ensure discipline on campuses

title: CT, MRI services resume in districts after disruption; protests erupt in some hospitals
content: The Health Department says patients will not be affected as scanning facilities have been mapped to nearby government and empanelled private institutions within the same district

title: A.P. govt. signs MoU with IIC to strengthen Mid-day Meal Scheme
content: Modern technology to ensure accurate estimation of the number of students consuming meals, monitoring of nutritional standards and reducing administrative burden

title: A.P.'s liabilities touched ₹9.74 lakh crore by June 2024: Payyavula
content: Total net borrowings during 2024–25 stood at ₹60,485 crore and for 2025–26, up to December 31, at ₹53,878 crore, says Finance Minister

title: BJP MLA’s ‘sexist’ remarks in Rajasthan Assembly spark protests by activists
content: Bahadur Singh Koli, representing Bharatpur district’s Weir constituency, said during the debate on the Budget

title: Concern over move to discontinue Elderline’s State-level operations
content: It is feared that the conversion of the helpline into a centralised zonal project from April 1 will impact quality of assistance provided to the elderly

title: Supreme Court takes up suo motu case to strengthen Bar bodies
content: Supreme Court directs the formulation of terms of reference for a mechanism to bring transparency and accountability to the functioning of such forums

title: Karnataka RTC unions withdraw strike plan; set March 2 deadline for govt. to mee their demands
content: RTC officials stated that the protest had little impact on bus services across the State on Thursday, with overall fleet utilisation exceeding 96%

title: Sabarimala gold ‘theft’: Samples to be handed over to National Metallurgical Laboratory, Jamshedpur for scientific examination, Kerala HC told
content: The laboratory has intimated that the tests will be conducted expeditiously and that the results will be furnished at the earliest, free of cost, considering their significance.

title: A.P. budget this year shifted gears towards all-round progress: Finance Minister Keshav
content: The first budget tabled by him had to clean up the mess created by the YSRCP and the second one just about managed to put the economy back on the tracks, says Payyavula Keshav in the Assembly

title: Govt. demands apology from YSRCP for ‘wrong claims’ on ghee supplied to TTD during its term
content: Despite laboratory reports and findings of the Supreme Court-appointed Special Investigation Team, Leader of the Opposition in Legislative Council Botcha Satyanarayana is maintaining that no adulteration has taken place, says Agriculture Minister Atchannaidu

title: Infiltration foiled along LoC in J&K’s Rajouri, says Army
content: A high state of operational alert continues to be maintained across Rajouri sector, says an Army spokesperson

title: Next AI Impact Summit will be held in Geneva, says Switzerland’s President
content: Smaller countries must cooperate on AI for all, not just in the hands of a few “big powers”, says Guy Parmelin

title: Kerala is a ray of light amid darkness of communalism and fascism, says Binoy Viswam
content: CPI State secretary inaugurates State Service Pensioners’ Council meet in Thrissur; new 85-member State committee elected

title: Priyanka Gandhi releases ‘charge sheet’ against Assam government
content: In the 20-point document, Congress accuses the BJP-led government of indulging in large-scale corruption and giving away the lands of the indigenous people to corporate houses

title: Heritage Foods never supplied ghee to TTD, says B.R. Naidu
content: YSRCP making frivolous charges against the ruling dispensation in a desperate bid to divert public attention from its corrupt role in ghee supply during its regime, alleges the TTD Chairman

title: HC issues notice to CBFC, producers of film Kerala Story 2 - Goes Beyond
content: HC move in the wake of a petition that challenges the issuance of censor certificate to the film which, according to the petitioner, has the potential to disturb public order and incite communal disharmony

title: Rahul Gandhi to lay foundation stone for 50 houses for Wayanad landslides survivors on February 26
content: Congress housing project at Meppadi to cover 5.42 acres; financial aid of ₹5 lakh each for 40 affected traders also to be handed over

title: 6,794 forest land titles distributed in Thrissur: Minister
content: State accelerates pending claims, uploads 4,123 cases for Centre’s approval; 980 hectares likely to be handed over to eligible occupants

title: Madras High Court revives hearing of cases against ECR bungalows of Vijay, Kamal Haasan, Udhayanidhi Stalin
content: Justices Anita Sumanth and Mummineni Sudheer Kumar order disposal of property owners’ statutory appeals before May 31, 2026

title: VACB questions Sree Narayana Dharma Paripalana (SNDP) Yogam general secretary Vellappally Natesan in the microfinance fraud case
content: The prosecution’s case is that the suspects fraudulently misappropriated large sums of money borrowed from banks through the Kerala State Backwards Classes Development Corporation under the pretext of providing seed money to economically challenged SNDP Union members, mostly women, to start household-level enterprises  in soap, pickle, jam and incense stick making.

title: Kerala sets up committees to exempt settlements from wildlife sanctuary buffer zones
content: Committees will gather feedback from local representatives, prepare draft guidelines, and submit them to government for detailed review before forwarding them to National Wildlife Board, says Minister

title: Cherukolpuzha meet demands withdrawal of cases against Ayyappa devotees
content: In memorandum to government, Hindu religious meet says cases registered against those who participated in the Sabarimala Namajapa protests in 2018 should be withdrawn

title: 110 people elected to Nair Service Society delegates’ council
content: 118 vacancies reported in council. While 110 members were elected unopposed, remaining eight positions will be filled through a ballot election

title: Heritage–Indapur nexus exposed, claims YSRCP chief Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: He accuses Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu of shielding ‘irregularities’ in the supply of adulterated ghee, terms State Budget as a bundle of lies

title: After SC rebukes Allahabad HC judge for ‘unreasoned’ order, Bar association writes to CJI against such ‘stigmatic’ remarks
content: In an order on February 9, a Bench of Justices J.B. Pardiwala and K.V. Viswanathan had termed an order passed by Justice Pankaj Bhatia of the Lucknow Bench of Allahabad HC in a dowry death case as one of the “most shocking and disappointing orders that it has come across over a period of time”.

title: Trump Warns Of "Bad Things" If Iran Doesn't Make A Deal
content: Iran held annual military drills with Russia on Thursday as a second American aircraft carrier drew closer to the Middle East, with both the United States and Iran signaling they are prepared for war if talks on Tehran's nuclear program fizzle out.

title: "No Better Place Than India To Discuss AI Transformation": Rishi Sunak
content: Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Thursday called India the ideal venue for shaping the future of artificial intelligence (AI), and said there was "no better place" to deliberate on the global AI transformation than India.

title: 'India To Be OpenAI's Biggest Market Soon': Sam Altman At AI Impact Summit
content: India is set to become the biggest market for OpenAI in the near future, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said on Thursday.

title: Unable To Bear Labour Pain, Woman Slits Abdomen, Delivers Healthy Baby Later
content: A 35-year-old pregnant woman on Thursday allegedly slit her own abdomen with a kitchen knife after she could not bear the labour pain and later delivered a healthy baby girl in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich district, officials said.

title: 'No Technology Makes Me Dream Bigger Than AI': Sundar Pichai At India Summit
content: Alphabet and Google CEO Sundar Pichai on Thursday told world leaders that artificial intelligence (AI) is the technology that inspired him the most and represented the "biggest platform shift of our lifetimes".

title: Ahead Of Assembly Polls, Shot In The Arm For DMK With A Fresh Alliance
content: In a significant political development ahead of the Tamil Nadu Assembly elections, the Desiya Murpokku Dravida Kazhagam (DMDK) led by Premalatha Vijayakanth has joined the ruling DMK alliance headed by Chief Minister MK Stalin.

title: 9 Lose Eyes, 9 Lose Vision After Cataract Surgeries In UP, Hospital Sealed
content: As many as nine patients had to get an eye removed, and nine others lost vision in one of the eyes after they developed an infection following cataract surgeries at a private hospital here, prompting authorities to seal the facility.

title: Indian-Origin Woman Jailed For Slapping 73-Year-Old Taxi Driver In Singapore
content: An Indian-origin Singaporean woman was sentenced to two weeks in jail on Thursday for voluntarily causing hurt by slapping a taxi driver, allegedly over a fare at a police station.

title: 'National Image Dented': Top Court Slams Pharma Firm Over Cough Syrup Deaths In Uzbekistan
content: "Do you realise what dent it has caused to the country's image?" the Supreme Court on Thursday asked a pharmaceutical firm whose cough syrups allegedly resulted in the death of more than 18 children in Uzbekistan.

title: Tripura Woman, 19, Brutally Assaulted By Live-In Partner In Gurugram
content: A 19-year-old man has been arrested by Gurugram Police after a biotechnology student was allegedly brutally assaulted by her live-in partner at a paying guest accommodation in the city.

title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor Has Debts to Pay
content: King Charles' troublesome younger brother had already been caught lying about his friendship with the late pedophile Jeffrey Epstein, making his denials of sexual wrongdoing, including allegedly abusing the late Virginia Giuffre when she was 17.

title: AI, Semiconductors, Water Tech: What PM Modi, Dick Schoof Discussed
content: India and the Netherlands are setting the stage for a major expansion of their strategic partnership, with a sharp focus on artificial intelligence, semiconductors, water management and emerging technologies.

title: Austria Sees Huge Scope For AI Collaboration With India: Top Official To NDTV
content: Austria's State Secretary for Digitalisation and e-Governance, Alexander Proll, on Tuesday underlined the growing scope for bilateral cooperation between India and Austria in the field of artificial intelligence.

title: Amit Shah To Be In Assam Ahead of Polls, Will Visit Bangladesh Border
content: Union home minister Amit Shah will arrive in Assam's Silchar on Thursday night for a three-day visit to the state, ahead of the assembly elections in the state.

title: Andrew Can Be Kept In Custody For 4 Days At Most, Likely To Be Released In 1
content: In one of the gravest crises to affect the House of Windsor, Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was arrested on Thursday on suspicion of misconduct in public office in connection with his close relationship with late paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Shillong MP Ricky Syngkon Collapses During Football Match, Dies
content: Shillong MP Ricky AJ Syngkon, of the Voice of the People Party (VPP), died on Thursday evening after suddenly falling ill while playing football, triggering widespread shock and grief across Meghalaya's political spectrum.

title: '2 Attempts Were Made To Cut Deal With Imran Khan, He Refused': Pak PM's Aide
content: A close aide of Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has said that jailed former premier Imran Khan was offered a "deal" twice but he declined to accept it.

title: 12 Seconds Apart: Twin Seismic Pulses In China That Set Off US Nuclear Alarm
content: A small tremor rippled through a remote corner of Central Asia in June 2020. It registered at 2.75 on the seismic scale. The signal was picked up by a monitoring station in Kazakhstan operated by the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty Organisation

title: Advantage BJP As 37 Seats Up For Grabs In Big Rajya Sabha Battle
content: The race for the Rajya Sabha is set to intensify with elections to 37 seats across 10 states scheduled for March 16, and early trends suggest the BJP-led NDA could further consolidate its position in the Upper House.

title: Middle East on boil: 5 reasons why Trump may attack Iran anytime now
content: The United States and Iran are nearing a potential military confrontation as diplomacy falters and military preparations intensify.  A significant US military buildup in the Middle East, coupled with Iran's fortification of nuclear sites, raises fears of a major escalation.  Despite ongoing talks, key gaps remain, and Washington is weighing military options.

title: 'Appeasing policy': Why SC flagged 'freebies culture' and cautioned states
content: The Supreme Court expressed serious concerns over the growing culture of freebies in states, warning it could hamper economic development and strain finances. Justices questioned whether indiscriminate distribution of benefits, without distinguishing between the needy and others, amounts to an appeasing policy that could weaken work culture and development efforts.

title: 'Someday, I won't be here': Trump says Board of Peace will oversee UN
content: America will boost the United Nations. President Donald Trump revealed plans to support the global body financially and ensure its proper functioning. This initiative is part of his peace plan for Gaza. Trump believes the UN has great potential and aims to help it achieve it. He also mentioned past successes in settling wars without UN involvement.

title: Accommodation row rocks Pakistan hockey: PHF chief resigns after banning captain
content: Pakistan Hockey Federation president Tariq Bugti resigned following a controversy over the national team's accommodation during their Australia tour. The issue gained traction after a video showed players with luggage on the street, despite the captain initially claiming all was fine.

title: After CEO's 'exit' warning, Accenture now has an 'AI rule' for promotions
content: Accenture is tying senior staff promotions to AI tool usage, requiring "regular adoption" as a criterion for leadership roles. The consulting giant is also tracking individual weekly logins to its AI tools. The move follows CEO Julie Sweet's earlier warning that non-adapters would be "exited." Internally, some employees have pushed back, calling the tools "broken slop generators." The policy comes as Accenture's share price has fallen roughly 42% over the past year.

title: ‘I almost terminated him’: Why did Trump say he wanted to fire Marco Rubio?
content: President Trump playfully teased Secretary of State Marco Rubio and First Lady Melania Trump about sharing the spotlight at the inaugural Board of Peace meeting.  The board, focused on the Gaza ceasefire and rebuilding, saw pledges of $7 billion from several nations, with the US contributing $10 billion. Trump praised both Rubio and Vice President Vance for their contributions.

title: Saudi Arabia vs UAE: How India and Pakistan are reshaping the Gulf split
content: Saudi Arabia and the UAE, once close allies, are now locked in open rivalry, impacting the Yemen war, cross-border trade, and regional flashpoints. This strategic split challenges core assumptions about Gulf stability and investor confidence. The dispute, fueled by economic competition and differing regional visions, is escalating with potential for proxy conflicts and business friction.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai urges tech companies to work together
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai calls for tech companies to unite on AI. He emphasizes innovation and empowering workers. Pichai highlights AI's potential to improve lives and solve scientific challenges. He stresses responsible development and collaboration between governments and companies. This collective effort is crucial for realizing AI's full benefits for everyone.

title: The great billing heist: How powerful 'delete' tool helped eateries hide crores from tax net
content: Tax investigators in Hyderabad have uncovered a powerful 'delete' function in restaurant billing software, enabling widespread sales suppression. This feature, allowing deletion of up to a month's sales history, has led to probes into numerous eateries, with some accused of evading taxes on crores annually. AI tools are aiding the crackdown.

title: Flooding shuts down Baglihar hydropower project in J&K
content: Operations at the Baglihar hydropower project's stage 1 in Jammu and Kashmir were halted due to flooding in the machine room. While stage 1 remains suspended for scheduled maintenance, stage 2, unaffected by the flooding, will continue to generate power. This allows for stage 2 to operate during the lean period when it would typically be closed.

title: Infiltration bid foiled, terror module busted in Rajouri
content: Troops thwarted an infiltration attempt along the LoC in Jammu's Sunderbani sector. In a separate operation in Nowshera, a terror module was busted, leading to the arrest of a suspected associate and the seizure of a significant arms cache, dismantling a trans-border weapons racket.

title: Google releases Gemini 3.1 Pro: Here's what's new and who gets it first
content: Google has unveiled Gemini 3.1 Pro, a powerful AI upgrade emphasizing enhanced reasoning for complex tasks. This new model excels at synthesizing data, generating animated SVGs from text, and tackling intricate technical problems.  It significantly outperforms previous versions on key benchmarks, promising a leap in AI capabilities for both consumers and developers.

title: House of the Dragon Season 3 teaser out, fans call it ‘The fire rises again!’
content: The highly anticipated teaser for House of the Dragon Season 3 has arrived, showcasing the debut of Tessarion, the "Blue Queen," signaling a new aerial threat.  Fans are buzzing with excitement online, while HBO confirms the series is planned for a four-season arc, charting the Targaryen history towards a definitive conclusion.

title: Daily Horoscope: Today's astrological predictions for February 20, 2026
content: Horoscope Today: Read daily horoscope predictions for February 20, 2026. Know all about the astrological events and influences that will be affecting each of the 12 zodiac signs. Our astrologer has analyzed the movements of the planets and the alignment of the stars to bring you the most accurate and up-to-date horoscope predictions for the day ahead. Get ready to discover what the stars have in store for you today.

title: NBA trade news: Warriors sign $60M Celtics big, skip Giannis chase
content: The Golden State Warriors have acquired Kristaps Porzingis from the Atlanta Hawks, trading away Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield. This move aims to bolster the frontcourt and scoring after Jimmy Butler's season-ending injury. While Porzingis offers valuable spacing and shooting, his durability remains a significant concern for the team's playoff aspirations.

title: Tom Brady’s ‘not-that-serious’ Alix Earle fling: Is it more?
content: Tom Brady’s reported ‘not-that-serious’ fling with influencer Alix Earle suddenly looks a lot more intentional. Page Six says the retired quarterback is ‘very particular’ and ‘doesn’t hook up with just anyone’ as clips from St. Barts and Super Bowl weekend keep going viral. Here’s how the rumored pairing really started and where it might be heading next for both people.

title: Lakers legend Magic Johnson sends birthday message to Michael Jordan
content: Magic Johnson shared a heartfelt birthday message for Michael Jordan following 23XI Racing’s first Daytona 500 victory. Jordan called the win championship-like, yet celebration footage showing him interacting with Tyler Reddick’s young son sparked online debate. Reddick defended Jordan, saying critics misread the moment, while the milestone win remained a historic achievement for the NASCAR team.

title: 'I don't believe in media censorship': J&K CM Omar Abdullah
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah asserted his commitment against media censorship and using government advertisements for influence. He pledged to rationalize the advertisement policy for transparency, basing allocations on objective criteria like circulation and readership. Abdullah also highlighted efforts to fill thousands of vacant government posts and stressed the urgency of climate change response for the region.

title: After Andrew's arrest, King Charles says 'law must take its course' in personally signed statement
content: King Charles expressed deep concern over his brother Andrew's arrest, assuring full royal family cooperation with authorities. He emphasized that the law must take its course, with the investigation proceeding fairly.  The Prince and Princess of Wales reportedly back the King's stance. This marks a historic moment, with Andrew being the first senior royal arrested in nearly 400 years.

title: LaMelo Ball car collection: 5 wild rides worth $1.2M
content: LaMelo Ball's impressive car collection, valued at over $1.2 million, reflects his unique brand. From a custom Hummer EV tribute to his sneakers to a Mansory Rolls-Royce and a color-shifting Ferrari, his vehicles showcase a blend of luxury, speed, and personalized flair, making him stand out on and off the court.

title: Andrew, former prince, arrested at his royal residence over Epstein scandal
content: Prince Andrew, King Charles's brother, was arrested on his birthday at Sandringham Estate. Police took him into custody on suspicion of misconduct in public office. The arrest follows revelations from the Jeffrey Epstein files. Allegations suggest Andrew shared confidential UK government information with Epstein. This marks a significant moment in modern British royal history. Buckingham Palace was not informed beforehand.

title: Trump withdraws support for Chagos deal as four Chagossians land on disputed archipelago
content: US President Donald Trump has reversed his stance, withdrawing support for the UK's deal to transfer the Chagos Islands to Mauritius. Trump called the agreement a "big mistake" and questioned the validity of claims to the islands, emphasizing the importance of the Diego Garcia military base.

title: Stephen Curry kids: How many children do he and Ayesha have?
content: Basketball star Stephen Curry and his wife Ayesha are navigating a busy life with four children: Riley, Ryan, Canon, and baby Caius.  From viral moments to family traditions, their journey as parents is filled with love and 'beautiful chaos.' The couple, who met as kids, now cherishes their growing family.

title: 'We keep our sights forward': Zimbabwe send warning after taking down SL and Aus
content: Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza believes their strong group stage, including wins over Australia and Sri Lanka, has earned them respect heading into the Super Eights. Despite facing formidable opponents like India and South Africa, Raza remains unfazed, emphasizing a game-by-game approach and the team's confidence in their preparation and clear roles.

title: Why Shivaji Maharaj–Tipu Sultan comparison sparked row - explained
content: In Maharashtra, Shivaji Maharaj occupies an almost sacred position across ideological lines, but particularly within the political vocabulary of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and Shiv Sena. The Maratha ruler is frequently invoked as a symbol of indigenous sovereignty, martial pride and cultural assertion. References to Hindavi Swarajya resonate strongly with narratives centred on civilisational identity and self-determination.

title: Deadly thread in the sky: Why Chinese manjha remains a killer
content: Chinese manjha, a sharp synthetic kite string, poses a deadly threat during Indian festivals, causing severe injuries and fatalities to motorcyclists and birds. Despite government bans and enforcement drives, its illegal sale persists, turning a cherished tradition into a recurring public safety crisis.

title: 'Makes your country stronger': Macron on criticism over Rafale deal in India
content: French President Emmanuel Macron defended the Rafale deal, stating it strengthens India's defense capabilities and strategic coordination. He emphasized France's commitment to increasing Indian components and manufacturing critical devices in India, including co-production of combat aircraft and maintenance. This comes as India's Defence Acquisition Council cleared the procurement of 114 Rafale fighter jets.

title: Nikhil Gupta, Pannun plot & Nijjar connection: Inside a case that spanned 3 continents
content: Hardeep Singh Nijjar, a Khalistani separatist, was assassinated in Canada, sparking diplomatic tensions. Simultaneously, a plot to kill Gurpatwant Singh Pannun in the US was uncovered, leading to the arrest of Indian national Nikhil Gupta. US authorities allege an Indian government employee directed the plot, a claim India disputes, suggesting a rogue operation.

title: More lethal than Bumrah? Ex-India captain makes big claim on Varun Chakravarthy
content: Former India captain Kris Srikkanth has lauded Varun Chakravarthy as India's most dangerous weapon in the T20 World Cup 2026, even suggesting he's more lethal than Jasprit Bumrah. Srikkanth highlighted Varun's exceptional form and deceptive variations, noting batters' struggles to decipher his bowling. He believes Varun deserves more recognition and could be Player of the Tournament.

title: 'Nothing like money': Trump claims '200% tariffs' warning forced India, Pak to stop fighting
content: Donald Trump claimed he averted war between India and Pakistan in May 2025 by threatening a 200% tariff on both nations. Speaking at his "Board of Peace" event, Trump cited Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif as validating his mediation efforts. India, however, has distanced itself from these claims, with Prime Minister Modi stating no foreign power mediated the situation.

title: Veteran filmmaker MM Baig found dead at home
content: Veteran filmmaker M. M. Baig, known for his work in Hindi cinema and as the father of former child actor Baby Guddu, was found dead at his residence earlier this week. He was in his 70s. The news was confirmed by his publicist, Hanif Zaveri.

title: 'Will know in 10 days': Trump warns of 'bad things' if Iran doesn't make meaningful deal
content: America may take further action regarding Iran within ten days. President Donald Trump stated that if a meaningful deal is not reached, negative consequences will follow. Talks are ongoing, described as constructive but historically difficult. The US has increased military presence in the Middle East amid rising tensions. Iran has reinforced nuclear and missile sites.

title: Ex-prince Andrew arrested: What recent files revealed about his ties with Epstein
content: Prince Andrew was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office following new documents linking him to Jeffrey Epstein. These files include photographs and emails suggesting Andrew shared trade reports and discussed meetings with women. Several UK police forces are now reviewing material related to his association with the convicted sex offender.

title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: Aviation ministry to release preliminary report in 30 days
content: The Ministry of Civil Aviation will release a preliminary report on the Baramati Learjet crash within 30 days. The investigation is being conducted by the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau. Flight recorders are being examined. The ministry assures a thorough, evidence-based probe. Special audits of aircraft operators are also underway. This follows demands for a CBI inquiry into the accident.

title: Taylor Swift at 2026 Brit Awards: Will Travis Kelce meet her $140M ex?
content: Taylor Swift has quietly landed in the U.K. ahead of the Feb. 28 Brit Awards, with reports pointing to a secret plan for a surprise appearance and a possible red carpet run-in with ex Harry Styles. Here’s how her travel dates, awards buzz, remix rollout, and Travis Kelce’s open schedule all fuel the growing speculation around a huge pop culture moment.

title: Indian visas in Bangladesh likely to be 'fully restored' soon as Rahman takes charge
content: India is set to "fully restore" its visa services in Bangladesh. This comes after a recent change in Bangladesh's political leadership. Aniruddha Das, a senior Indian consular official, confirmed the steps to fully restore services. Medical and double-entry visas are already being issued. Other categories, including travel visas, will also resume soon. This move signals a strengthening of India-Bangladesh relations.

title: Quote of the day by Marcus Aurelius: “Time is a sort of river of passing events...
content: Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, a Stoic philosopher, led during a turbulent era. His private "Meditations" reveal a mind seeking wisdom through self-control and humility.  Aurelius's reflection on time as a flowing river emphasizes acceptance of change, fostering emotional balance and mindful living.

title: Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium not to host Ranji final; here's why
content: The Ranji Trophy final between Karnataka and Jammu and Kashmir will be held in Hubballi, not Bengaluru, due to ongoing safety upgrades at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium. This strategic move, confirmed by KSCA, aims to ensure a high-quality spectator experience and promote cricket statewide, fostering fan engagement beyond the capital.

title: Sikandar roars in Colombo: Zimbabwe stun Sri Lanka, fire warning shot at India
content: Riding on their captain Sikandar Raza’s brilliance, Zimbabwe cruised to an emphatic six-wicket win over co-hosts Sri Lanka. Chasing 178, Zimbabwe finished the job with three balls to spare, underlining their authority in the group stage, which they closed unbeaten, highlighted by victories over Sri Lanka and Australia.

title: DeenTheGreat apologizes after Tiki Ghosn clash, addresses Dana White
content: Nurideen “DeenTheGreat” apologized to Tiki Ghosn after being knocked out during a February 17, 2026 livestream altercation. On February 18, he admitted he was drunk and accepted responsibility. He also addressed Dana White posting about the incident and spoke about a recent slap from Larry Wheels that injured his jaw. Neither Ghosn nor White has responded publicly.

title: ‘Moldy rooms and sticky pillows’: Nainital hotel stay sparks outrage
content: A planned Nainital getaway for two friends quickly soured when their booked hotel was unexpectedly changed due to 'technical issues.' Upon arrival, they were directed to a dilapidated, questionable establishment, leading them to abandon the reservation and seek an alternative destination.

content: Gab Marcotti looks at the reasons why premier league clubs were able to pass the £3 billion mark in transfer spending in the summer window . from next season, the league will switch from Profit and Sustainability Rules (PSR) to Squad Cost Ratio (SCR) regulations, marking the latest shift in english soccer's financial landscape .

title: Fly high, free bird! Postgame takeaways, grades and more from Team USA's OT thriller
content: team USA overcame adversity on Sweden's late tying goal to win the game in overtime . team USA entered the event with the second-best gold medal odds, behind canada . the team in third? Sweden .

title: Three A's, a whole lot of B's and one F. Final offseason grades for all 30 teams
content: the world baseball Classic is just around the corner . it has been an interesting offseason with some impact trades, some surprising free agent signings and, of course, every team improving . let's find out who the big winners are: AL East: BAL | BOS | NYY | TB | TOR AL Central: CHW | CLE | DET | KC | MIN AL West: ATH | HOU | LAA | NYM | PHI | WSH NL Central: CHC | C

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Auburn's fortunes continue to slide after another loss
content: teams have roughly four weeks until selection Sunday to strengthen their cases . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on how likely they are to make the field of 68 as one of the 37 at-large selections . the selection committee will evaluate teams' underlying potential .

title: Power Rankings: A 1-2 showdown on tap this weekend!
content: Michigan vs. Duke on Saturday has been circled on calendars of men's college hoops diehards . both teams ranked in the preseason top 10 . it's no. 1 in six of seven NCAA team sheet metrics, ranking no. 2 in the BPI .

title: One proposal fixes the NBA’s tanking problem: Turning losses into wins
content: the Indiana Pacers are in the nation's capital to face the Washington Wizards . it's a game that should be compelling . Ivica Zubac , Indiana's recently acquired starting center, has yet to play for the club . he remains out with an ankle injury .

title: Jets, warships and bombers: Inside Washington’s expanding military squeeze on Iran
content: as tensions surge between Washington and Tehran, president Donald Trump has assembled a formidable display of air power across the Middle East and beyond . he has gathered the most air power in Middle East since the 2003 Iraq Invasion . the military build-up now resembles the posture that preceded last June’s strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities but on a larger scale .
